title: 80th Anniversary of the Battle of Iwo Jima
summary:
The document is a proclamation by President Donald J. Trump, declaring February 19, 2025, as the 80th Anniversary of the Battle of Iwo Jima. It commemorates the significant military campaign that began on February 19, 1945, during World War II, which saw U.S. Marines engage in intense combat against Japanese forces for 36 days. The proclamation highlights the bravery of the Marines, particularly the iconic moment when six Marines raised the American flag on Mount Suribachi, symbolizing their courage and resolve.

The battle resulted in heavy casualties, with nearly 7,000 Marines and Sailors losing their lives and 20,000 wounded. It is noted that 27 individuals received the Medal of Honor for their acts of valor during this battle, underscoring its historical significance. The proclamation emphasizes the enduring legacy of the sacrifice made by those who fought at Iwo Jima and the importance of remembering their heroism. It also reflects on the U.S.-Japan alliance as a foundation for peace in the Indo-Pacific region.

The document calls on all Americans to honor the contributions of the Greatest Generation and to commit to building a future worthy of their sacrifices.
